wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Lawranson (or Lawrenson) (fl. 1760–1777) was an Irish painter.Lawranson signed the roll of the Incorporated Society of Artists in 1766, and is first styled a fellow of the society in 1774. He lived in Great Russell Street, Bloomsbury, London. A portrait of Lawranson was painted and engraved in mezzotint by his son William Lawranson.

response: He was the son of Thomas Lawranson. In 1760 and 1761 he obtained premiums from the Society of Arts. He was, like his father, a fellow of the Incorporated Society of Artists.
